results.title: Snowdon on camera. Parts 1 and 2
results.creator_credit: British Broadcasting Corporation and Iain Johnstone
results.brief_description: Lord Snowden, a well known photographer examines varying techniques and discusses the work of two photographers who have influenced him. He emphasises the importance of the eye rather than the camera and challenges the claim that photography requires complicated equipment and lighting. He also discusses the value of photographs to different people.

results.title: Snowbound
results.creator_credit: Learning Corporation of America, Linda Gottlieb and Robert Young
results.brief_description: A shortened version of the motion picture “Snowbound”. Features two teenagers who learn to understand themselves and each other when they are caught in a desolate area during a snow storm. Written by Edward Pomerantz and Kurt Villadsen from the book by Harry Mazer.

results.title: Snowbirds
results.creator_credit: Nimbus Film Productions, ONF | NFB and Michael Brun
results.brief_description: From cockpit to ground to sky, the camera follows the spectacular aerobatics of the Canadian Forces Air Demonstration team who control their 9.7 m long, single-engine jets as if they were extensions of their own bodies. During practice sessions, their maneuvers are videotaped for the pilots’ viewing and subsequent correction. Narrated by Alan Bleviss.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Nimbus Film Productions, ONF | NFB and Michael Brun

results.title: Snow, sand and savages: the life of Frank Hurley
results.creator_credit: Anthony Buckley Productions and Anthony Buckley
results.brief_description: This is a portrait of Frank Hurley - pioneer cameraman, war photographer, explorer, film director, writer, lecturer, broadcaster and Australia’s best known stills photographer. ‘Snow, sand and savages’ pays tribute to Hurley’s life and work and covers his first trip to Antarctica with Mawson and Shackleton, his 1919 footage of the Ross and Keith Smith flight from London to Australia, his 1920’s expeditions to New Guinea, and his coverage of both world wars. Some light relief is included with an excerpt from Hurley’s foray into feature films with ‘The Jungle woman’ in 1926. Narrated by Leo McKern and written by Joan Long.

results.title: Snow falling on cedars [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Kennedy/Marshall Company, Harry J Ufland, Ron Bass-Kennedy, Universal Pictures, Kathleen Kennedy, Garry Marshall, Ron Bass and Scott Hicks
results.brief_description: Nine years after the bombing of Pearl Harbour, a small town in the Pacific Northwest still struggles with the troubling legacy of U.S. policies against Asian-Americans. In December 1950, just off the shores of San Piedro Island in Washington, a Japanese-American man Kazuo Miyamoto (Rick Yune) stands accused of murder after his close friend Carl Heine (Eric Thal) is found drowned in icy waters. As the trial gets under way, with Alvin Hooks (James Rebhorn) prosecuting Kazuo and Nels Gudmundsson (Max Von Sydow) defending him, reporter Ishmael Chambers (Ethan Hawke) covers the proceedings for the local newspaper. The trial strikes a deep emotional chord with Ishmael when he finds his ex-lover is linked to the case. As he investigates the killing he uncovers some startling clues that lead him to a shocking discovery. Based on the novel of the same name by David Guterson.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kennedy/Marshall Company, Harry J Ufland, Ron Bass-Kennedy, Universal Pictures, Kathleen Kennedy, Garry Marshall, Ron Bass and Scott Hicks

results.title: Snow cat: based on the book by Dayal Kaur Khalsa
results.creator_credit: Snow Cat Productions, ONF | NFB, Sheldon Cohen, Kenneth Hirsch and Marcy Page
results.brief_description: On a cold snowy afternoon, a grandmother captivates her granddaughter’s attention with the tale of a lonely girl and a magic cat. A story of enduring love by artist and filmmaker Sheldon Cohen, recipient of many prestigious prizes, including the British Academy Award. In ‘Snow cat’ he works collaboratively with animator Jeami, who designed an original finger-paint technique for the film.
results.title_for_label: Snow cat: based on the book by Dayal Kaur Khalsa

results.title: Snow camp
results.creator_credit: Tasmanian State Film Unit and National Fitness Council of Tasmania
results.brief_description: Aimed at the experienced bushwalker, this film discusses survival in the snow country. Includes instructions on the building of igloos and other shelters. Suitable for upper secondary and teertiary levels.
